title: How to See Facebook Friendship: Quick and Easy Steps

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. This app icon looks like a lowercase "f" on a blue background. You can find it on one of your home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. Log in if prompted. If you logged out of your previous Facebook session, you will be asked to log in. Enter your registered email address and password in the fields provided. Tap Log in to continue to your account.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's in the lower right corner for iPhones and iPads or in the upper right corner if you're using an Android.

steps.title: Tap Friends.
steps.content: Tap Friends . You'll see this among the tiles underneath your name.

steps.title: Tap Your friends, and then See all.
steps.content: Tap Your friends , and then See all . You'll see a list of all your added friends.

steps.title: Tap a friend.
steps.content: Tap a friend. Tap on the profile picture of a friend you want to view. Your friend’s Facebook page will load.

steps.title: Tap ••• .
steps.content: Tap ••• . You'll see this three-dot menu icon under your friend's cover photo and to the right side of your screen.

steps.title: Tap See Friendship.
steps.content: Tap See Friendship . This menu option is near the middle of the menu next to the Friendship icon. You'll see things in common that you have with this person (like mutual friends and if you live in the same city), as well as the interactions you've had. Tapping a post will redirect you to the original post.

steps.title: Go to the Facebook website and log in.
steps.content: Go to the Facebook website and log in. You can use any computer or laptop web browser to see the desktop site and do this.

steps.title: Click Friends.
steps.content: Click Friends . It's in the panel on the left side of the page next to a friends icon.

steps.title: Click All friends.
steps.content: Click All friends . You'll see this in the middle of the menu on the left side of the page. After clicking this, you'll see a list of all your friends.

steps.title: Select a friend.
steps.content: Select a friend. Click the name of the friend you want to view. Your friend’s Facebook page will load.

steps.title: Click ••• .
steps.content: Click ••• . You'll see this three-dot menu icon under your friend's cover photo and to the right side of the page.

steps.title: Click See Friendship.
steps.content: Click See Friendship . You can see here how many things you have in common, when you became friends on Facebook, and some other information about your friend. You can see any mutual friends you have as well as if you both live in the same city or if you're in the same groups. Under Photos , you'll see photos that have both you and your friend. You can also browse the timeline to see your interactions. [1] X Research source Clicking a post will redirect you to the original post.

steps.title: A friendship page exists for all your Facebook friends.
steps.content: A friendship page exists for all your Facebook friends. Friendship pages lets you see everything you have in common with a specific friend, such as posts, networks, photos, and more. Visiting someone's friendship page is a quick way to find photos of you and a friend together.

steps.title: You can only view your friendship page for yourself and one other friend.
steps.content: You can only view your friendship page for yourself and one other friend. While you were able to view your shared content with two other friends at the same time, Facebook has removed this feature. You can still manually check for shared content by looking at their tagged photos, liked pages, and other content on their profile.
